definitions.explanation_en: A surname of Scottish origin, commonly found in English-speaking countries; historically derived from the given name 'Reid,' meaning 'red' (referring to hair color or complexion).
definitions.explanation_cn: 源自苏格兰的姓氏，在英语国家中常见；历史上由名字 'Reid' 演变而来，意为‘红色的’（指发色或肤色）。
definitions.example_en: Dr. Reid is a renowned neuroscientist at Harvard University.
definitions.example_cn: 里德博士是哈佛大学著名的神经科学家。
